Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac NF M 37, UTO 3
Related: All three undertext objects belong to a single Old Syriac Gospel manuscript, of which the undertext of Syr NF 39 is also part; fol. 1v is followed by Syr NF 39, fol. 9, and fol. 6r is preceded by Syr NF 39, fol. 16v.
Foliation: The two folios are not contiguous. Folios in order of reconstructed undertext: 1r, 1v, 6r, 6v.
Page layout: Number of lines is irregular, ranging from 26 to 30

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery,Syriac 50 + NF M 50 + NF M 63 + Chabot 75
AltTitle.other: Services for selected festivals of the ecclesiastical year
Place of origin: Monastery of St Panteleimon on the Black Mountain near Antioch
Foliation: Reconstructed foliation is as follows: Syriac NF M 50, ff. 1-3, NF M 63, ff. 3-4, Chabot 75, Syriac NF M 50, ff. 4-5, NF M 63, f. 1, NF M 50, ff. 11-16, NF M 63, f. 2, Syriac 50, ff. 1-99. Syriac NF M 50, ff. 1-3, NF M 63, ff. 3-4, and Chabot 75’s sequence is unclear and may belong to either the first or second quire
Collation: Quire signatures in Syriac in the bottom margin of the first and the last folio of each quire; signatures in Greek in top left corner of the first folio (partially preserved); Syriac and Greek numbering do not correspond; quires of 8 ff., with the exception of quires IX (ff. 41-46, 6 folios) and XV (ff. 88-91, 4 folios)
